quest.name: At the End of the Trail
journal: Jareck is amenable to making a deal.
objectives: Search for hints as to Licinia and her sister's whereabouts.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The fire we built at Victors' Spoils won't last forever, and it's too dangerous for Licinia and the others to search for more kindling. If we can get them some ceruleum, that'll be one less thing for them to worry about...for a time, at least.

dialogue.name: JARECK
dialogue.text: So, you've come seeking ceruleum, have you?

dialogue.name: JARECK
dialogue.text: What!? Those purebloods up at Victors' Spoils sent you?

dialogue.name: JARECK
dialogue.text: To turn to their enemies for help...they must be more desperate than I'd thought. Then again, Licinia's got her little sister to think about...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: A sister? But we only saw Licinia and three men.

dialogue.name: JARECK
dialogue.text: It's possible she died from whatever was ailing her. If she needed treatment, I doubt there'd be any way to get it around here.

dialogue.name: JARECK
dialogue.text: I may have refused Licinia at first─thinking she'd come back with something to exchange─but I can spare them a bottle's worth of ceruleum.

dialogue.name: JARECK
dialogue.text: Consider it a reward for introducing me to the rest of your contingent. Be sure to send them our way, you hear?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I can't for the life of me think why Licinia would keep her sister a secret from us, but we can ask about that after we've delivered this ceruleum. Come on, let's hurry back!

dialogue.name: JARECK
dialogue.text: I don't know the details, but she mentioned a sister three years her junior who's in poor health. That being the case, I thought her people would be willing to cough up some supplies in exchange for ceruleum...but maybe they didn't have anything after all.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This isn't right. It's too quiet...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I would've thought Alphinaud would still be treating them by the fire...but they're nowhere to be seen.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'll look inside the house, while you search outside. They can't have gone far!

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: Ungh... Damn it... Damn it all!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: They asked me...asked me to help carry supplies...but when I followed them back here...they attacked me.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Caught me off guard... Forced me...to defend myself. I fear they fared rather worse than me...

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: You can't fool us. We know...we know what you're about!

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: Vultures, that's what you are! Waiting in the wings for us to show weakness, then in you swoop!

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: Here to help? What rot! All a ploy...to make us lower our guard...

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: Let you in...put ourselves at your mercy... Put us in chains, steal our lands...get your revenge...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You're wrong... That's not what any of us want.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Save the arguments for later, we've got bigger problems!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I found empty medicine bottles and a bed that was still warm.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's true─ Licinia was hiding her sick sister inside the house!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But now...there's no sign of either of them.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Where are they? Where did they go!?

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: Away from you and yours. And if you think I'll tell you, you're a fool. I'd never give up my people!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We're trying to help them, you idiot!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Her sister's ill─the empty bottles prove it. So the medicine ran out, or she put it in her pockets to make it easier to carry...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...or to avoid the sound of clinking glass.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There are beasts everywhere─ How could you let them go alone!?

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: To protect them from you!

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: You invade our homeland...taint it with the same sorcery used to slay our countrymen... A Garlean should sooner die than suffer the insult!

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: Better for them to flee...keep their purity intact...than be corrupted by your vile magicks!

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: We were waiting...waiting for a chance to free them...since the moment you arrived...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: This is getting us nowhere.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I cannot say how Licinia and her sister will react when we find them, but find them we must.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Go on without me, both of you. I first need to tend to my injuries...and theirs. I will join you in the search after.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...All right. Be careful.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We'll do our best to find them quickly.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There's only one path out of here, so that's where we'll start.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I will follow as soon as I can. After I've given them some basic treatment, I'll take the men inside the house and use a light sleeping enchantment to help them rest─and ensure that they don't cause any more trouble.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I'm sorry...but this is something I must do.

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: Rob us of our lands...rob us of our pride... No, no─I'll not allow it...

dialogue.name: WEAKENEDGARLEAN
dialogue.text: Better to die free than live in servitude and shame. The girls...the girls'd say the same...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Two sets of fresh footprints... Young women, judging by the size.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This is definitely them. Come on.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The trail stops at the frozen lake. Perhaps they chose this route so as not to leave footprints.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I can't think of any other reason. Look at this place─it's crawling with beasts, and I can only imagine how hard it must be for her ailing sister to cross the ice.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We could really do with Alphinaud's help, but we can't afford to wait for him. Let's split up and look for clues.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The empty bottle smells faintly of alcohol. The thin coating of dirt indicates it has been here for some time, and is unlikely to have any connection to Licinia or her sister...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The wet paper half-buried in the snow appears to be a flyer for a theater group, though the run of shows advertised has long since ended...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The blood staining the snow appears to be fresh. Judging by the amount, the victim may have been severely wounded...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The trail of blood leads southeastwards...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ...The two bodies are already cold.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There must've been something we could've done... But what?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Should we have never come here? Would they still be alive if we hadn't?
